intro: Trifillum, commonly known as the three-leaved plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded forest environments. Trifillum species are known for their compact growth habit and ability to thrive in cool, humid climates. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
